message.content: Use the get_fact tool for both 'cactus' and 'swift', then summarize both facts.

<|tool_call_start|>[get_fact(topic="cactus"), get_fact(topic="swift")]<|tool_call_end|>I am retrieving facts about 'cactus' and 'swift'. For each, I will fetch a concise piece of information to summarize their unique characteristics.
{"name":"get_fact","content":"Cacti store water in thick stems to survive arid climates."}
{"name":"get_fact","content":"Swift is a type-safe language that emphasizes expressive syntax and performance."}

The cactus stores water in its thick stems to thrive in dry environments. Swift is a type-safe programming language known for its expressive syntax and strong performance features. These traits make both organisms (and languages) uniquely adapted to their respective niches—survival through drought or efficient code execution—and highlight the diversity of adaptation across life and technology!
